newsitem.title: ESTONIA: SIX COMPANIES MAKE BIDS FOR EMEX.
newsitem.headline: SIX COMPANIES MAKE BIDS FOR EMEX.

text.p: The Estonian privatization agency said on Thursday that six offers were submitted for the sale of a 51 percent stake in the Estonian Metal Export (EMEX) company.
German HKS GmbH Handelgesellschaft, Estonian Neotrust, Amalard, Transkorp, Nelimet and Kuusakoski OU were the companies which submitted offers, the agency said in a statement.
The agency will by June 6 select one or several of the bidders to go through to a second round of privatisation.
EMEX has a monopoly in Estonia's metal export and import. The agency sold five percent of its shares for vouchers last year, which are traded on the OTC market now.
EMEX had a net profit of 18.7 million kroons and turnover of 301.7 million kroons in 1996.
In the first quarter of this year, it had profit of 4.9 million kroons and turnover of 68.1 million kroons.
